subject: Is there a place for private methods with TDD?
msgSnippet: In a class (see below) with two public methods A & B that both call private method C, what s the best approach for unit testing it? Should test scenarios for A
messageBody:
In a class (see below) with two public methods A & B that both call private
method C, what's the best approach for unit testing it? Should test
scenarios for A or B cover what may happen in C ? If so, is it just accepted
as a code management overhead to ensure that C is properly tested via tests
for A or B ?

If you use TDD would you ever end up with private methods, declaring them as
protected instead?

class MyClass
{
public void A()
{
...
C();
}
public void B()
{
...
C();
}
private void C()
{
...
}
}
